title: Corpse Pose
content:
## Sanskrit Name
Savasana

## Category
Supine

## Benefits
- Calms the brain and helps relieve stress and mild depression
- Relaxes the body
- Reduces headache, fatigue, and insomnia
- Helps to lower blood pressure

## Contraindications
- Back injury or discomfort

## Modifications
- Blanket under the head
- Blanket under knees
- Blanket under heels

title: Knees to Chest Pose
content:
## Sanskrit Name
Apanasana

## Category
Supine

## Benefits
- Relieves lower back pain
- Relieves gastrointestinal discomfort

## Contraindications
- Not recommended after second trimester of pregnancy

## Modifications
- Blanket underneath head

## Preparatory Poses
- Child's Pose

title: Happy Baby Pose
content:
## Sanskrit Name
Ananda Balasana

## Category
Supine

## Benefits
- Gently stretches the inner groins and back spine
- Calms the brain and helps relieve stress and fatigue

## Contraindications
- Knee injury
- Neck injury

## Modifications
- Hold ankles or calves
- Place a blanket under head or hips

## Preparatory Poses
- Child's Pose
- Hero's Pose

title: Reclining Hero Pose
content:
## Sanskrit Name
Supta Virasana

## Category
Supine

## Benefits
- Stretches the abdomen, thighs and deep hip flexors
- Opens the chest and shoulders
- Improves digestion
- Helps relieve respiratory conditions
- Reduces fatigue

## Contraindications
- Knee injury
- Ankle problems
- Lower back issues
- Heart conditions

## Modifications
- Support upper body with bolster or blankets
- Keep knees wider apart
- Use blocks under hips

## Preparatory Poses
- Hero's Pose
- Thunderbolt Pose
- Bound Angle Pose
- Bridge Pose

title: Revolved Abdomen Pose
content:
## Sanskrit Name

## Category
Supine

## Benefits
- Stretches the back muscles
- Realigns and lengthens the spine

- Improves digestion

## Contraindications
- Knee injury
- Hip injury
- Back injury

## Modifications
- Place a blanket under the knees
- Eagle pose legs

## Preparatory Poses
- Half Lord of the Fishes Pose
- Eagle Pose

title: Hand-to-Big Toe Pose
content:
## Sanskrit Name
Padangusthasana

## Category
Supine

## Benefits
- Stretches hips, thighs, hamstrings, groins, and calves
- Strengthens the knees
- Stimulates the prostate gland
- Improves digestion
- Relieves backache, sciatica, and menstrual discomfort

## Contraindications
- Headache
- High blood pressure

## Modifications
- Strap around foot

## Preparatory Poses
- Downward Facing Dog Pose
- Bound Angle Pose
- Standing Forward Fold

title: Reclining Bound Angle Pose
content:
## Sanskrit Name
Supta Baddha Konasana

## Category
Supine

## Benefits
- Opens the hips and groin
- Stimulates abdominal organs and improves circulation
- Helps relieve stress and anxiety
- Stretches the inner thighs
- Beneficial for menstrual discomfort

## Contraindications
- Groin or knee injury
- Lower back issues

## Modifications
- Support knees with blocks or blankets
- Bolster under the spine
- Pillow under head and neck

## Preparatory Poses
- Bound Angle Pose
- Hand-to-Big Toe Pose
- Hero's Pose
- Child's Pose

title: Reclining Hand-to-Big-Toe Pose
content:
## Sanskrit Name
Supta Padangusthasana

## Category
Supine

## Benefits
- Stretches hamstrings, calves, and groins

- Relieves backache and sciatica

## Contraindications

title: Lord of the Dance Pose
content:
## Sanskrit Name
Natarajasana

## Category
Standing Balance

## Benefits
- Stretches the shoulders and chest
- Stretches the thighs, groins, and abdomen
- Strengthens the legs and ankles
- Improves balance

## Contraindications
- Back injury
- Shoulder injury
- Quadricep injury

## Modifications
- Hands on a wall
- Hold foot without leaning forward

## Preparatory Poses

- Hand-to-Big Toe Pose
- Upward Bow Pose
- Camel Pose
- Standing Forward Fold
- Warrior III
- Warrior I
- Hero's Pose
- Tree Pose

title: Eagle Pose
content:
## Sanskrit Name

## Category
Standing Balance

## Benefits
- Strengthens and stretches the ankles and calves
- Stretches the thighs, hips, shoulders, and upper back
- Improves concentration
- Improves sense of balance

## Contraindications
- Knee injury

## Modifications
- Brace yourself on a wall
- Keep wrapped foot on the ground

## Preparatory Poses
- Downward Facing Dog Pose
- Cow Face Pose

- Tree Pose

title: Tree Pose
content:
## Sanskrit Name
Vrksasana

## Category
Standing Balance

## Benefits
- Strengthens thighs, calves, ankles, and spine
- Stretches the groins and inner thighs, chest and shoulders
- Improves sense of balance
- Relieves sciatica and reduces flat feet

## Contraindications
- Headache
- Insomnia
- Low blood pressure
- High blood pressure

## Modifications
- Stand with back against a wall
- Heel on ankle with toes still on floor

## Preparatory Poses
- Bound Angle Pose
- Extended Triangle
- Warrior II

content:

title: Thunderbolt Pose
content:
## Sanskrit Name

## Category
Seated

## Benefits
- Stretches the thighs, knees, and ankles
- Strengthens the arches
- Improves digestion and relieves gas
- Helps relieve menopause symptoms

- Therapeutic for high blood pressure and asthma

## Contraindications
- Heart problems
- Headache
- Knee or ankle injury

## Modifications
- Place a blanket or block between the sit bones and the calves

## Preparatory Poses
- Child's Pose
- Bound Angle Pose

content:
## Sanskrit Name
Virasana

Seated

- Stretches the thighs, knees, and ankles

title: Bound Angle Pose
content:
## Sanskrit Name

Seated

- Soothes menstrual discomfort and sciatica
- Helps relieve menopause symptoms

- Don't fold forward

title: Boat Pose
content:
## Sanskrit Name
Navasana

## Category
Seated

- Strengthens the abdomen, hip flexors, and spine

- Improves digestion

## Contraindications

- Insomnia
- Low blood pressure
- Menstruation
- Pregnancy
- Neck injury

## Modifications

- Hold the backs of the thighs

title: Head-to-Knee Pose
content:
## Sanskrit Name
Janu Sirsasana

Seated

title: Seated Forward Fold
content:
## Sanskrit Name
Paschimottanasana

## Category

## Benefits
- Calms the brain and helps relieve stress and mild depression
- Stretches the spine, shoulders, hamstrings
- Stimulates the liver, kidneys, ovaries, and uterus
- Improves digestion
- Helps relieve the symptoms of menopause and menstrual discomfort
- Soothes headache and anxiety and reduces fatigue

- Hamstring injury

- Strap around the feet
- Blanket under the knees

## Preparatory Poses

- Standing Forward Fold

content:
## Sanskrit Name
Sirsasana

Inversion

- Calms the brain and helps relieve stress and mild depression
- Stimulates the pituitary and pineal glands
- Strengthens the arms, legs, and spine

- Headache

- Menstruation

- Calms the brain and helps relieve stress and mild depression
- Stretches the shoulders, hamstrings, calves, and arches
- Strengthens the arms and legs
- Helps relieve menopause symptoms
- Relieves menstrual discomfort when done with head supported
- Helps prevent osteoporosis
- Improves digestion
- Relieves headache, insomnia, back pain, and fatigue

- Neck injury

## Modifications

## Preparatory Poses

content:

Inversion

content:
## Sanskrit Name
Salamba Sarvangasana

## Category
Inversion

## Benefits
- Calms the brain and helps relieve stress and mild depression
- Stimulates the thyroid and prostate glands and abdominal organs
- Stretches the shoulders and neck
- Tones the legs and buttocks
- Improves digestion
- Helps relieve menopause symptoms
- Reduces fatigue and alleviates insomnia

## Contraindications
- Headache
- High blood pressure
- Menstruation
- Neck injury

title: Legs-Up-The-Wall Pose
content:
## Sanskrit Name
Viparita Karani

## Category
Inversion

## Benefits
- Relieves tired or cramped legs and feet
- Gently stretches the back legs, front torso, and back of the neck
- Relieves mild backache
- Calms the mind

## Contraindications
- Serious eye problems like glaucoma
- Serious neck or back problems
- Menstruation (check with teacher)

## Modifications
- Blanket under hips
- Hips farther away from the wall for tight hamstrings

## Preparatory Poses
- Bridge Pose
- Reclining Bound Angle Pose
- Standing Forward Fold
- Hero's Pose

title: Downward Facing Dog Pose
content:
## Sanskrit Name
Adho Mukha Svanasana

## Category
Inversion

## Benefits
- Calms the brain and helps relieve stress and mild depression
- Energizes the body
- Stretches the shoulders, hamstrings, calves, arches, and hands
- Strengthens the arms and legs
- Helps relieve the symptoms of menopause
- Relieves menstrual discomfort when done with head supported
- Helps prevent osteoporosis
- Improves digestion
- Relieves headache, insomnia, back pain, and fatigue
- Therapeutic for high blood pressure, asthma, flat feet, sciatica, sinusitis

## Contraindications
- Carpal tunnel syndrome
- Wrist or shoulder injury
- Pregnancy: Do not do this pose late-term.
- High blood pressure or headache: Support your head on a bolster or block, ears level between the arms.

## Modifications
- Hands on blocks
- Bent knees

## Preparatory Poses
- Plank Pose
- Standing Forward Fold

title: Standing Splits
content:
## Sanskrit Name
Urdhva Prasarita Eka Padasana

Internal Rotation

## Benefits
- Calms the brain
- Stimulates the liver and kidneys
- Stretches the hamstrings, calves, and thighs
- Strengthens the thighs, knees, and ankles
- Stretches the back of the leg, the front thigh and groin

## Contraindications
- Lower back injury
- Ankle or knee injury
- Hamstring injury

## Modifications
- Hands on a block

## Preparatory Poses
- Standing Forward Fold
- Hand to Big Toe Pose
- Wide-leg Forward Fold
- Downward Facing Dog Pose
- Head-to-Knee Pose
- Seated Forward Fold
- Hand-to-Big Toe Pose

content:

Internal Rotation

## Benefits
- Stretches the chest, lungs, shoulders, neck, belly, groins
- Strengthens the shoulders, arms, and back muscles
- Strengthens and stretches the thighs, calves, and ankles

## Contraindications
- High blood pressure
- Heart problems
- Shoulder problems

## Modifications
- Keep the ball of back foot lifted
- Hold a strap if shoulders are tight

## Preparatory Poses
- Downward Facing Dog Pose
- Wide-leg Forward Fold
- Warrior I
- Hero's Pose

title: Warrior I
content:
## Sanskrit Name
Virabhadrasana I

## Category
Internal Rotation

## Benefits
- Stretches the chest, lungs, shoulders, neck, belly, groins
- Strengthens the shoulders, arms, and back muscles
- Strengthens and stretches the thighs, calves, and ankles

## Contraindications
- High blood pressure
- Heart problems
- Shoulder problems

## Modifications
- Keep the ball of back foot lifted

## Preparatory Poses
- Downward Facing Dog Pose
- Wide-leg Forward Fold
- Reclining Bound Angle Pose
- Warrior II
- Hero's Pose

title: High Lunge
content:
## Sanskrit Name
Ashta Chandrasana

## Category
Internal Rotation

## Benefits
- Stretches the hip flexors and quadriceps
- Stretches the shoulders and chest

## Contraindications
- Heart problems

## Modifications
- Back knee on a block or the ground
- Hands on your hips
- Hands on the ground

## Preparatory Poses
- Downward Facing Dog Pose
- Wide-leg Forward Fold
- Chair Pose
- Hero's Pose

title: Low Lunge
content:
## Sanskrit Name
Anjaneyasana

## Category
Internal Rotation

## Benefits
- Stretches the hip flexors and quadriceps
- Stretches the shoulders and chest

## Contraindications
- Heart problems

## Modifications

- Keep hands on ground

title: Revolved Chair Pose
content:
## Sanskrit Name
Parivrtta Utkatasana

## Category
Internal Rotation

## Benefits
- Strengthens the legs and ankles
- Tones the abdominal muscles
- Improves balance and coordination
- Stimulates digestive organs
- Increases spinal mobility

## Contraindications
- Low back injury
- Knee problems
- High blood pressure
- Headache

## Modifications
- Keep feet hip-width apart for stability
- Don't twist as deeply
- Keep hands in prayer position at heart center

## Preparatory Poses
- Chair Pose
- Revolved Triangle Pose
- Wide-leg Forward Fold
- Half Lord of the Fishes Pose

title: Chair Pose
content:
## Sanskrit Name
Utkatasana

## Category
Internal Rotation

## Benefits
- Strengthens the ankles, thighs, calves, and spine
- Stretches shoulders and chest
- Stimulates the abdominal organs, diaphragm, and heart
- Reduces flat feet

## Contraindications
- Headache
- Insomnia
- Low blood pressure

## Modifications
- Feet hip-width apart
- Hands at heart's center

## Preparatory Poses
- Hero's Pose
- Cobra Pose
- Downward Facing Dog Pose

title: Upward Salute
content:

title: Halfway Lift
content:

title: Standing Forward Fold
content:
## Sanskrit Name

Standing Balance

## Benefits
- Calms the brain and helps relieve stress and mild depression
- Stimulates the liver and kidneys
- Stretches the hamstrings, calves, and hips
- Strengthens the thighs and knees
- Improves digestion
- Reduces fatigue and anxiety
- Relieves headache and insomnia
- Therapeutic for asthma, high blood pressure, infertility, osteoporosis, and sinusitis

## Contraindications
- Back injury
- Hamstring injury

## Modifications

- Head-to-Knee Pose

- Hand-to-Big Toe Pose

title: Mountain Pose
content:

- Strengthens thighs, knees, and ankles
- Firms abdomen and buttocks

- Insomnia

title: Half Moon
content:

External Rotation

- Strengthens the abdomen, ankles, thighs, buttocks, and spine

title: Extended Triangle
content:
## Sanskrit Name

External Rotation

- Stretches and strengthens the thighs, knees, and ankles

- Improves digestion

- Therapeutic for anxiety, flat feet, neck pain, osteoporosis, and sciatica

- Low blood pressure

- Neck problems

title: Fish Pose
content:

Backbend

title: Bridge Pose
content:
## Sanskrit Name

Backbend

- Stretches the chest, neck, and spine
- Calms the brain and helps alleviate stress and mild depression
- Stimulates abdominal organs, lungs, and thyroid

- Improves digestion
- Helps relieve menopause symptoms
- Relieves menstrual discomfort when done supported
- Reduces anxiety, fatigue, backache, headache, and insomnia

## Contraindications
- Neck Injury

## Modifications
- Block or blanket under the hips

## Preparatory Poses
- Cobra Pose
- Upward Facing Dog Pose
- Hero's Pose
